get.description: This API will return data about all our ATMs and is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all ATMs in the specified country. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all ATMs within a 5 mile radius of the specified postcode. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Letters and numerals only. No spaces or special characters. eg  &quotSW1A1AA&quot

get.description: This extended API will return data about all ATMs in the specified town. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will data about all ATMs within a specified radius (1 to 10 miles) of the specified latitude and longitude. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Positive or negative decimal value in degrees. eg &quot51.50551621597067&quot

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Positive or negative decimal value in degrees. eg &quot-0.0180120225995&quot

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Number of miles (1 to 10) as an integer. Default = 1

get.description: This API will return the branch details for all branches and is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return the branch details for all branches in the specified country. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return the branch details for all branches within a 5 mile radius of the specified postcode. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Letters and numerals only. No spaces or special characters. eg. &quotSW1A1AA&quot

get.description: This extended API will return the branch details for all branches in the specified town. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return the branch details for a branch specified by its sort code. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

parameters.name: sortcode
parameters.description: 6 digit number with no spaces or special characters. eg. &quot400003&quot

get.description: This API will return the branch details for all branches within a specified radius (1 to 10 miles) of the specified latitude and longitude. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Positive or negative decimal value in degrees. eg &quot51.50551621597067&quot

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Positive or negative decimal value in degrees. eg &quot-0.0180120225995&quot

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Number of miles (1 to 10) as an integer. Default = 1

get.description: This API will return data about all PCA productsand is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all PCA products for the specified segment. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This API will return data about all BCA productsand is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all BCA products for the specified segment. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This API will return data about all SME lending productsand is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all SME lending products for the specified segment. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This API will return data about all commercial credit cards productsand is prepared to the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. It is regulated by the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

This extended API will return data about all commercial credit cards products for the specified segment. It is based-on the Open Banking standards as defined by the Open Banking Implementation Entity (OBIE) in data dictionary version 2.2. The extended functionality may not fully adhere to the non-functional requirements of the regulator. Data is only available for the United Kingdom.

Type.description: Codeset to indicate if a branch is physically in 1 location or is mobile

SortCode.description: United Kingdom (UK) Sort Code - identifies British financial institutions on the British national clearing systems. The sort code, which is a six-digit number, is usually formatted as three pairs of numbers, for example 12-34-56. It identifies both the bank and the branch(s) where the account is held.
SortCode.title: SortCode

CustomerSegment.description: The marketing segment which the branch is able to address in terms of customer type. Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another
CustomerSegment.title: CustomerSegment

OpeningHours.description: Opening & Closing Times of a branch of an organisation
OpeningHours.title: OpeningHours

items.description: Opening & Closing Times of a branch of an organisation

OpeningTime.description:
A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar day expressed in either UTC time format (hh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (hh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (hh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
Note on the time format:
1) beginning / end of calendar day
00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day
24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day
2) fractions of second in time format
Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.
OpeningTime.title: OpeningTime

ClosingTime.description:
A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar day expressed in either UTC time format (hh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (hh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (hh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
Note on the time format:
1) beginning / end of calendar day
00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day
24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day
2) fractions of second in time format
Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.
ClosingTime.title: ClosingTime

StartDate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
StartDate.title: StartDate

EndDate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
EndDate.title: EndDate

PCA.title: PCA

Name.description: The name of the PCA product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. I.e. what the customer would recognise.
Name.title: Name

Identification.description: The unique ID that has been internally assigned by the financial institution to each of the current account banking products they market to their retail and/or small to medium enterprise (SME) customers.
Identification.title: Identification

Segment.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd 
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to PCA products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on. For example, Basic PCA products target consumers with poor credit history, Reward PCA products target consumers who spend a lot, and Premium products target High Net Worth individuals.
Segment.title: Segment

items.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd 
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to PCA products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on. For example, Basic PCA products target consumers with poor credit history, Reward PCA products target consumers who spend a lot, and Premium products target High Net Worth individuals.

CreditInterest.description: Details about the interest that may be payable to the PCA account holders
CreditInterest.title: CreditInterest

TierBandSet.description: The group of tiers or bands for which credit interest can be applied.
TierBandSet.title: TierBandSet

items.description: The group of tiers or bands for which credit interest can be applied.

TierBandMethod.description:
The methodology of how credit interest is paid/applied. It can be:-

1. Banded
Interest rates are banded. i.e. Increasing rate on whole balance as balance increases.

2. Tiered
Interest rates are tiered. i.e. increasing rate for each tier as balance increases, but interest paid on tier fixed for that tier and not on whole balance.

3. Whole
The same interest rate is applied irrespective of the PCA balance
TierBandMethod.title: TierBandMethod

Destination.description: Describes whether accrued interest is payable only to the PCA or to another bank account
Destination.title: Destination

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the Tier Band Set details
Notes.title: Notes

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a PCA.
Identification.title: Identification

TierValueMinimum.description: Minimum deposit value for which the credit interest tier applies.
TierValueMinimum.title: TierValueMinimum

TierValueMaximum.description: Maximum deposit value for which the credit interest tier applies.
TierValueMaximum.title: TierValueMaximum

CalculationFrequency.description: How often is credit interest calculated for the account.
CalculationFrequency.title: CalculationFrequency

ApplicationFrequency.description: How often is interest applied to the PCA for this tier/band i.e. how often the financial institution pays accumulated interest to the customer's PCA.
ApplicationFrequency.title: ApplicationFrequency

FixedVariableInterestRateType.description: Type of interest rate, Fixed or Variable
FixedVariableInterestRateType.title: FixedVariableInterestRateType

AER.description:
The annual equivalent rate (AER) is interest that is calculated under the assumption that any interest paid is combined with the original balance and the next interest payment will be based on the slightly higher account balance. Overall, this means that interest can be compounded several times in a year depending on the number of times that interest payments are made. 

Read more: Annual Equivalent Rate (AER) http://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/aer.asp#ixzz4gfR7IO1A
AER.title: AER

BankInterestRateType.description: Interest rate types, other than AER, which financial institutions may use to describe the annual interest rate payable to the PCA.
BankInterestRateType.title: BankInterestRateType

Notes.title: Notes

Notes.description: Associated Notes about the overdraft rates
Notes.title: Notes

TcsAndCsURL.description: URL provided by the financial institution which redirects to the PCA Overdraft T&Cs on an external website
TcsAndCsURL.title: TcsAndCsURL

TierBandMethod.description:
The methodology of how overdraft is charged. It can be:
'Whole'  Where the same charge/rate is applied to the entirety of the overdraft balance (where charges are applicable). 
'Tiered' Where different charges/rates are applied dependent on overdraft maximum and minimum balance amount tiers defined by the lending financial organisation
'Banded' Where different charges/rates are applied dependent on overdraft maximum and minimum balance amount bands defined by a government organisation.
TierBandMethod.title: TierBandMethod

OverdraftType.description: An overdraft can either be 'committed' which means that the facility cannot be withdrawn without reasonable notification before it's agreed end date, or 'on demand' which means that the financial institution can demand repayment at any point in time.
OverdraftType.title: OverdraftType

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a overdraft product.
Identification.title: Identification

AuthorisedIndicator.description: Indicates if the Overdraft is authorised (Y) or unauthorised (N)
AuthorisedIndicator.title: AuthorisedIndicator

BufferAmount.description: When a customer exceeds their credit limit, a financial institution will not charge the customer unauthorised overdraft charges if they do not exceed by more than the buffer amount. Note: Authorised overdraft charges may still apply.
BufferAmount.title: BufferAmount

MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount.description: An overdraft is an extension of credit from a lending institution when an account reaches zero. An overdraft allows the individual to continue withdrawing money even if the account has no funds in it or not enough to cover the withdrawal. Some banking products require an accountholder to take an Arranged Overdraft(minimum) of at least X amount, or else a bank will not process an Arranged Overdraft request.
MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount.title: MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the overdraft Tier Band Set details
Notes.title: Notes

OverdraftTierBand.description: Provides overdraft details for a specific tier or band
OverdraftTierBand.title: OverdraftTierBand

items.description: Provides overdraft details for a specific tier or band

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a overdraft.
Identification.title: Identification

OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage.description: Interest charged on whole amount or tiered/banded
OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage.title: OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage

BankGuaranteedIndicator.description: Indicates that a bank provides the overdraft limit up to TierValueMIn to all customers automatically
BankGuaranteedIndicator.title: BankGuaranteedIndicator

EAR.description:
EAR means Effective Annual Rate and/or Equivalent Annual Rate (frequently
used interchangeably), being the actual annual interest rate of an Overdraft.
EAR.title: EAR

Notes.title: Notes

Eligibility.description: Eligibility details for this product i.e. the criteria that an accountholder has to meet in order to be eligible for the PCA product.

OtherEligibility.description: Other eligibility which is not covered by the main eligibility of the PCA product
OtherEligibility.title: OtherEligibility

items.description: Other eligibility which is not covered by the main eligibility of the PCA product

Name.description: Name provided for the eligibility criteria
Name.title: Name

Description.description: Full description for the eligibility criteria
Description.title: Description

Type.description: Eligibility type - method by which we group eligibilities for comparison purposes.
Type.title: Type

Amount.description: Any eligibility criteria where an amount is required to be specified e.g. Minimum Age.
Amount.title: Amount

Indicator.description: Any eligibility criteria where the value can be indicated by a true or false value. UKResident is True or False
Indicator.title: Indicator

Textual.description: Any eligibility criteria where a long description is supplied
